intro: Andesanthus wurdackii, commonly known as the Andean beauty, is a striking flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, velvety flowers. The plant produces large, trumpet-shaped blooms in shades of red, orange, and yellow, often with a contrasting central stripe. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts who appreciate its unique appearance.
